content.description: Start the route with a scramble up the boulders to the left of the major ledge where the difficulties of the route begin (5.2). From the ledge, follow cracks up the face directly in front of you (5.7). Before reaching a bush, commit to the steep arete, and gain the face (5.7). Once there, scramble on an easy slab up to a group of blocks. Follow the mild slope of the wall to the anchor (5.4). This is fun and a great choice for families and kids.
content.protection:
A standard rack up to #3s with a few smaller cams and nuts will suffice for all routes on Quarantine Wall, the smaller subdivision of Dude’s Throne that contains

Social Distancing

and those to its right.
content.location: Use approach for Dude’s Throne, then continue (south) past it to reach the base of Quarantine Wall. Find a left-facing corner with a minor overhang to the right of it.

content.description: The namesake of the wall, this route is definitely worth climbing. Start the route by climbing the small boulders opposite the wall (Class 3). Step across the notch onto the main wall, and pull a few moves to a large ledge (5.2). The steep chimney above is the attraction of this route. Begin on a narrow crack on the left side of the chimney. Follow it until it dead ends into a shallow, horizontal crack (5.7). Above use the abundance of features and cracks while stemming up to the another ledge (5.6). Finish over some small blocks to the anchor (5.2).
content.protection: A standard rack up to #3s with a few smaller cams and nuts will suffice for all routes on Quarantine Wall, the smaller subdivision of Dude’s Throne that contains Social distancing and those to it’s right.
content.location: Walk to Dude’s Throne then continue south to Quarantine Wall. Squeeze through the notch formed by a large boulder and the wall. Emerge from the other side of the notch at the base of Quarantine Machine and Pulmonary Pain.

content.description: Find a way up the steep buttress at the bottom of the route. Starting left is easier but longer. Any way up the starting headwall is about 5.8. Once above the lower difficulties, climb up to the steep corner (5.4). Ascend the corner (5.7). As you near the top, choose to stay on your course, or step left onto the face and climb cracks there. Both are 5.8. Scramble over boulders to the anchor (5.2). This route might warrant 2 stars after cleaning.
content.protection:
A standard rack up to #3s with a few smaller cams and nuts will suffice for all routes on Quarantine Wall, the smaller subdivision of Dude’s Throne that contains

Social Distancing

and those to its right.
content.location:
Walk to Dude’s Throne, then continue south to Quarantine Wall. Squeeze through the notch formed by a large boulder and the wall. Emerge from the other side of the notch at the base of

Quarantine Machine

and Pulmonary Pain.

content.description:
Begin on the featured face left of the obvious main crack (5.6). Step across the corner into the main crack (5.7). Climb it! The first move in the crack is the hardest (5.7+). Follow the crack to a broad ledge (5.7). This is where climbers from

Men in Masks

may opt to join the route to avoid a difficult 5.9/10 finish. From here, climb the right side of the imposing bulge above you (5.6). Watch your head on the boulder above as you complete a short traverse to the anchors. A direct start up the main crack on this route is very fun but pushes the grade to 5.8.
content.protection:
A standard rack up to #3s with a few smaller cams and nuts will suffice for all routes on Quarantine Wall, the smaller subdivision of Dude’s Throne that contains

Social Distancing

and those to its right. A fixed nut can be found at the top of this route.
content.location: Use the approach for Dude’s Throne, then continue (south) past it to reach the base of Quarantine Wall. Find a left-facing corner with a minor overhang to the right of it.

content.description:
Start the route using cracks and ledges on the small face below and right of a flake (5.7). Reach the flake, and ascend over the flake until you stand atop it (5.6). A shallow crack system will provide the next obstacle. Climb directly up it (5.8+), or traverse drastically to the right, and climb up there (5.8). Reach a large ledge. Above you stands a threatening bulge. Climb the left side of it (5.9/10) or abandon Men in Masks, and follow the ledge to the right side of the bulge, where you can finish on

Mortality Rate

(5.6), before doing the short traverse to the anchor. This route is 5.8 if

Mortality Rate

is used to finish it.
content.protection:
A standard rack up to #3s with a few smaller cams and nuts will suffice for all routes on Quarantine Wall, the smaller subdivision of Dude’s Throne that contains

Social Distancing

and those to its right. A fixed nut marks the top of their route.
content.location: Find an obvious, deep crack bifurcating the face to the north of a notch between a huge boulder and the wall. This route starts several feet to the left of the obvious crack.

content.description: Begin with a fun diagonal crack up to the bottom of an overhang. From there, follow a horizontal seam over to the ledge (5.8+). Pull yourself around the corner onto a large ledge using a good sidepull (5.9). From the ledge, ascend up and right, past a small pine trying to grow from a crack (5.7). The difficulties of the route lie in the minor bulge above you. Stand up using a seam under a tiny overhang (5.9), then ascend the bulge (5.10). Reach a place where the angle relents and a group of blocks looms above. Scramble up the to the anchor (5.4). This is so fun!
content.protection:
A standard rack up to #3s with a few smaller cams and nuts will suffice for all routes on Quarantine Wall, the smaller subdivision of Dude’s Throne that contains

Social Distancing

and those to its right.
content.location: Use approach for Dude’s Throne then continue (south) past it to reach the base of Quarantine Wall. Find a left-facing corner with a minor overhang to the right of it.

content.description:
This fun “boulder problem” starts with

Quarantine Machine

but then traverses left (5.9) to a jug then reaches to a sloper, a monopocket, and a tiny ledge (5.11). Finally grab a fantastic rail on top (5.10), and top out (5.9). Using the boulder for stemming demotes this fantastic route to a boring 5.8.
content.protection:
A standard rack up to #3s with a few smaller cams and nuts will suffice for all routes on Quarantine Wall, the smaller subdivision of Dude’s Throne that contains

Social Distancing

and those to its right.
content.location:
Find a notch between a massive boulder and the wall. Start at

Quarantine Machine

, then traverse left at an obvious crack.

content.description: On the left side of the notch between the huge boulder and the wall, ascend ledge systems for several moves (5.10). As you rise, more ledges, although none as good as the first, provide the crux. The steep rock and poor holds pushes this route to 5.10d. Use the scarce holds to mount the lip of the cliff (5.10b). This nice climb is easily ruined and demoted to low 5th Class if the boulder is used for stemming.
content.protection:
Anchors can be shared with

Quarantine Machine

or built slightly to the north. A standard rack up to #3 and several nuts should work for all Quarantine Wall anchors.
content.location: The huge boulder makes an obvious landmark. Start on the left side of the notch.
